doc.field: Schroeder: Kohl is unsuited for the future

SPD challenger Schroeder called Chancellor Kohl "unsuited for the future." After 16 years in power, Kohl is no longer able to cluster the nation's creative capacities, Schroeder said during the Bundestag general debate on the 1999 budget. The Chancellor no longer perceives the situation of average wage earners, he stressed. Kohl split the nation in a social sense by his policies. In response, Union faction leader Schaeuble accused Schroeder of having drawn a caricature of reality in his envy-filled speech. But the social democrats would not succeed in inciting the Germans against each other. he said Schroeder again made clear that he stands for everything - and nothing at all.

Earlier, Chancellor Kohl had spoken out against trial and error politics. The present course is predictable and must therefore be held. Kohl defended the reconstruction work done in Eastern Germany. The first part of his speech had mainly turned around foreign policy matters. He said international trust was an important potential for Germany and must not be put in jeopardy.
Employers don't give alliance for labor much of a chance

In the opinion of Employers' Association's chairman Hundt, the "Alliance for Labor" planned by SPD and the Greens for the event of an election victory does not stand a chance in case of a reversal of the job stability reduction and social security reform. Hundt voiced this opinion during a Bonn podium discussion with unionist Riester, minister for labor designate of the SPD. Riester countered that discussions about this kind of alliance must be free from pre-conditioning by either side. Policy should not be subject to blackmail.
Mail truck assault apparently a fake

The spectacular assault on a mail truck near Aschaffenburg yesterday now appears to have been faked. In the meantime, the postal truck's driver has been arrested on charges of aiding and abetting the assailants. They had got away with a booty of gold worth DM 500,000.
